opendial.bn.distribs.densityfunctions

Class DirichletDensityFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.densityfunctions.DirichletDensityFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DensityFunction

    public class DirichletDensityFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements DensityFunction
    Density function for a Dirichlet distribution. The distribution is defined through an array of alpha hyper-parameters.
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Logger log 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirichletDensityFunction(double[] alphas)
      Create a new Dirichlet density function with the provided alpha parameters

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DirichletDensityFunction copy()
      Copies the density function (keeping the same alpha-values).

      Returns a discretised version of the Dirichlet.
      java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Element> generateXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
      Returns the XML representation (as a list of XML elements) of the density function
      double getCDF(double... x)
      Throws an exception (calculating the CDF of a Dirichlet is quite hard and not currently implemented).

      • getDensity

        public double getDensity(double... x)
        Returns the density for a given point x. The dimensionality of x must correspond to the dimensionality of the density function.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • discretise

        public java.util.Map<double[],java.lang.Double> discretise(int nbBuckets)
        Returns a discretised version of the Dirichlet. The discretised table is simply a list of X sampled values from the Dirichlet, each value having a probability 1/X.
        Specified by:
        discretise in interface DensityFunction
        Parameters:
        nbBuckets - the number of discretisation buckets
        Returns:
        the discretised version of the density function.

      • getCDF

        public double getCDF(double... x)
              throws DialException
        Throws an exception (calculating the CDF of a Dirichlet is quite hard and not currently implemented).
        Specified by:
        getCDF in interface DensityFunction
        Parameters:
        x - the (possibly multivariate) point x
        Returns:
        the cumulative probability from 0 to x
        Throws:
        DialException - if the CDF could not be extracted
